text:
When accessing ejb component from jsp, I either got ClassCastException,
StackOverflowError and other exceptions.  Put it simple, it does not work!

Here are my config and findings,
1)
All the classes that needed to access ejb are stored in WEB-INF/classes.

2)
If a servlet is created, all calls to ejb works because the compiled code
is stored in WEB-INF/classes.

3)
If a Jsp is created, all calls to ejb will fail because the compiled code
is not stored in WEB-INF/classes.

4)
If the compiled jsp code is copied to WEB-INF/classes, all calls to ejb work.

This problem only happens in tomcat4.0.  Could it be that tomcat4.0 uses
different classloader for jsp and non-jsp classes?

Thanks!

ct
creator: cctang@yahoo.com
remm@apache.org
text:
In case 3) the parent classloader should be the classloader containing /WEB-
INF/classes. So I think it should work.
Please send additional information (stack traces, sample JSP source, ...).

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
I would need more details to be able to fix or investigate the problem. If the
bug is confirmed, it may not be fixable, which means that a direct integration
between WL and Tomcat may not be possible, or may require additional step to
configure the naming environment.
